definition: to leave hospital/to be discharged from hospital

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: Molly after discharge, with little moxa came to a new home for illness.
sentences.chinese: 出院後莫利文帶小艾來到新的住處養病。

sentences.english: Yesterday, the new family was discharged from the St Charles Medical Centre in Bend, Oregon.
sentences.chinese: 昨天全家從俄勒岡州本德市聖查理醫療中心出院。
出院後隨訪無疼痛再發。

sentences.english: After leaving hospital, li Mou compensates for matters concerned with inn square bargaining.
sentences.chinese: 出院後，李某就和店方交涉賠償事宜。

sentences.english: Patient teaching for discharge begins when the patient returns from the OR.
sentences.chinese: 在病人從手術室返回時就應開始病人出院宣教。

sentences.english: Attention should be paid to drug resistance and dependence in the discharge medication of tuberculosis patients.
sentences.chinese: 對結核病患者出院帶藥應該注意耐藥性和患者依從性。

sentences.english: Shanxi confirmed human avian influenza cases, patients recovered and were discharged today.
sentences.chinese: 山西省確診的人禽流感個案，患者於今日康復出院。

sentences.english: Good recovery was achieved in all patients according to GOS scores.
sentences.chinese: 出院時病兒按GOS預後分級均恢復良好。

sentences.english: This patient was weaned from ECMO, survived and discharged from hospital.
sentences.chinese: 這個病人成功地脫離體外膜氧合併存活而出院。

sentences.english: This is the prescription for your discharged medicines. Please go to Satellite Pharmacy to receive your medicine.
sentences.chinese: 這是住院出院帶藥處方籤，請至病房衛星藥局領藥。

sentences.english: Four weeks after the complex reconstructive microsurgery he was able to leave the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 在進行了複雜的復原微創手術四周後，他出院了。

sentences.english: A large number of reporters waiting outside the hospital didi, discharge ShangHeng belt she rushed out of the trap.
sentences.chinese: 大批記者在醫院外等候迪迪出院，尚恆帶她衝出重圍。

sentences.english: After the operation, Jia Jia discharged.
sentences.chinese: 手術之後，佳佳康復出院。

sentences.english: In the first year after discharge, 91% of the patients required rehospitalization.
sentences.chinese: 在出院後的第一年間，有91%的病人需要再次住院。

sentences.english: Shd ask e doc not 2 predict when dad can discharge.
sentences.chinese: 該請醫生不要預測老爸何時出院。

sentences.english: AIf necessary, I can stay here to accompany you until you are discharged.
sentences.chinese: 有必要的話，我可以在這裏陪你到出院。

definition: to be in hospital/to be hospitalized
to receive hospital treatment/to be hospitalized
to transfer (a patient) to a different hospital/to transfer to hospital (e.g. a prisoner)
to recover completely (from illness or injury)
intravenous infusion/to get put on an IV
to put sb on an intravenous drip
